What is Breaking News?
هەواڵی برێک چیە؟

Breaking news is an event we didn't anticipate. It is an unexpected development that requires us to pull all our resources together immediately to provide quick and accurate information to our audience. In many cases we will "break" into our regular programming to tell the audience about it even if, at first, we don't have all the details.

Breaking news also refers to any significant advance on a story we're already covering. It can be a new piece of information that we feel our audience needs to know about. So the spectrum of breaking news is extensive, it can range from everything from a terror attack to something that's happening on the field of battle, to a weather event, to a political resignation.

Levels of Breaking News
ئاستەکانی هەواڵی شکاندن

Determining the level of a breaking news story is inherently subjective. A change in government in a smaller country is certainly a major political development there but it might not resonate beyond its borders. One producer might consider a development in a story to warrant breaking news coverage while others in the newsroom might dismiss it as an incremental development.

The third element we look at is the longevity of this breaking news event. How long this story is going to need our full-attention? Do we think this story which is currently developing will have longer-term implications?

سێیەمین توخمی کە ئێمە سەیری دەکەین درێژەدانی ئەم ڕووداوە هەواڵییە شکاوەیە. تا چەند ئەم چیرۆکە پێویستی بە سەرنجە تەواوەکەمانە؟ ئایا ئێمە پێمان وایە ئەم چیرۆکەی کە ئێستا لە پەرەسەندندایە دەرهاوێانی درێژ خایەنی دەبێت؟

Of course we don't have a crystal ball to help us predict the future. But we can assess the facts that we have at the time to determine a story's longevity. We know, for example, a major terrorist attack in a key metropolis of a global superpower will trigger a series of events that go way beyond the immediate ground zero of the story. Recognizing that, we prepare our coverage plans and restructure our teams to meet those upcoming needs.

The first element that we look at when determining the level of a breaking news story is its immediate impact. Is this event going to result in significant loss of life? Will this event push adversaries to war or pave the way for the end of a conflict? Will are its financial, social, or political ramifications?

Typically, for regular news events CNN relies on Senior News Editors, SNEs, to vet the information before it gets alerted. Our reporters or producers on the ground will call in with a news item and that information will be pulled together by newsdesk producers and then vetted by an SNE. They will check the sources of the story, double check the information and use years of experience in the industry to spot any potential discrepancies in the information.

As Caroline mentioned, there's a lot of things to do in the first instance of a breaking news moment. From a newsgathering perspective, you have to let other people in your organization know that you are aware of the news and that you are using all your resources to confirm it. You can do this via phone calls or alerts sent out on messaging groups. At CNN, a key tool that newsgathering teams use to alert others in the network that they are aware of reports emerging about a specific breaking news event is sending out a #WorkingToConfirm email.

وەک کارۆلین باسی کرد، زۆر شت هەیە بۆ ئەوەی لە یەکەم جاردا لە کاتی هەواڵی بەپەلەدا بیکەین. لەڕوانگەی هەواڵییەوە، پێویستە ڕێگە بدەیت کەسانی تر لە ڕێکخراوەکەت بزانن کە تۆ ئاگاداری هەواڵەکەیت و هەموو سەرچاوەکانی خۆت بەکاردێنیت بۆ پشتڕاستکردنەوەی. تۆ دەتوانیت ئەمە بکەیت لە ڕێگەی پەیوەندی تەلەفۆنی یان ئاگادارکردنەوەکان کە نێردراوە بۆ گروپەکانی نامە. لە سی ئێن ئێن، ئامڕازێکی سەرەکی کە تیمە هەواڵییەکان بەکاری دەهێنن بۆ ئاگادارکردنەوەی ئەوانی تر لە تۆڕەکە کە ئاگاداری ئەو ڕاپۆرتانەن کە دەردەکەون دەربارەی رووداوێکی هەواڵی بەپەلەی تایبەت، ئیمەیلێکی #WorkingToConfirm دەنێرن.

The aim of these messages are twofold. First, you are letting senior managers know something big is likely happening so they can start making decisions about deploying teams and whether CNN goes into "rolling" coverage.  Secondly, by letting everyone know you are aware of the story you're allowing a window of time to confirm details and to send out reportable lines.

After the SNE alerts the rest of the network that it is working to confirm breaking news story, the team must decide what resources might be needed to cover the story for CNN's multiple platforms. Which reporter can come up live for TV?  What confirmed information can CNN report on our digital platforms.

دوای ئەوەی ئێس ئێن ئی تەواوی تۆڕەکە ئاگادار دەکاتەوە کە کاردەکات بۆ پشتڕاستکردنەوەی چیرۆکی هەواڵی شکاندن، تیمەکە دەبێت بڕیار بدات کە چ سەرچاوەیەک پێویستە بۆ داپۆشینی چیرۆکەکە بۆ پلاتفۆرمە هەمەجۆرەکانی سی ئێن ئێن. کام هەواڵنێر دەتوانێت بە ڕاستەوخۆیی بێتە سەر تەلەفزیۆن؟  ئەو زانیارییانەی کە پشتڕاستیان کردەوە دەتوانن سی ئێن ئێن ڕاپۆرت لەسەر پلاتفۆرمە دیجیتاڵییەکانمان بکەن.

Reorganize your team. Breaking news coverage requires a lot of hands on deck. Pull team members that are not working on this story in and assign specific roles so everyone knows what they should be working on.

تیمەکەت ڕێک بخەوە. ڕووماڵکردنی هەواڵەکان پێویستی بە دەستێکی زۆر لەسەر کەشتیە ئەندامانی تیمەکە ڕاکێشە کە کار لەسەر ئەم چیرۆکە ناکەن و ڕۆڵی تایبەت دیاری دەکەن بۆ ئەوەی هەموو کەس بزانێت کە دەبێت لەسەر چی کار بکات.

Editorial Information. Keep the control rooms and programming teams up to date with the latest. Even if you think there has only been a slight movement on a story, it is good to update the teams. Control rooms like to hear from you.

زانیاری سەروتار. هێشتنەوەی ژوورەکانی کۆنترۆڵ و تیمی بەرنامەڕێژی نوێ لەگەڵ نوێترین. تەنانەت ئەگەر پێت وایە تەنها جووڵەیەکی کەم لەسەر چیرۆکێک هەبووە، باشە تیمەکان نوێ بکەنەوە. ژوورەکانی کۆنترۆڵ حەز دەکەن لە تۆ ببیستن.

Get on air. It is crucial to get your reporters on air on this story as soon as possible.  You don't need them to be on camera and you can start your coverage with a reporter on the phone. If you don't have any reporters on location, try bringing one of your reporters up from the closest hub or have eyewitnesses on the phone.

بە هەوادا بڕۆ زۆر گرنگە کە پەیامنێرەکانت بە زووترین کات لەسەر ئەم چیرۆکە بە هەوا بێنی.  تۆ پێویستت بە ئەوان نیە کە لەسەر کامێرا بن و دەتوانیت دەست بە داپۆشینەکەت بکەیت بە پەیامنێرێک لەسەر تەلەفۆنەکە. ئەگەر هیچ هەواڵنێرێکت نیە لەسەر شوێنەکە، هەوڵ بدە یەکێک لە پەیامنێرەکانت لە نزیکترین تەوەرەوە بهێنیت یان شایەتحاڵت هەبێت لەسەر تەلەفۆنەکە.

Keep everyone informed. Send out lists of the available reporters, available live shots, latest videos or social media content that has been cleared for use and who is doing what on the desk so everyone knows who to contact for their specific needs.

هەموو کەس ئاگادار ببەوە ناردنی لیستەکانی پەیامنێرە بەردەستەکان، تەقەی ڕاستەوخۆی بەردەست، نوێترین ڤیدیۆکان یان ناوەڕۆکی تۆڕە کۆمەڵایەتیەکان کە پاککراوەتەوە بۆ بەکارهێنان و کێ لەسەر مێزەکە چی دەکات بۆ ئەوەی هەموو کەس بزانێت کە کێ پەیوەندی بە پێداویستیە تایبەتەکانیەوە بکات.

Manage network communication. After the initial alert, setup a breaking news telephone bridge that everyone who is working on this story can join to listen in on the latest developments. This allows your newsgathering desk to focus on confirming lines and liaising with the teams on the ground instead of fielding multiple calls from control rooms or managers.

بەڕێوەبردنی پەیوەندی تۆڕ. دوای ئاگادار کردنەوە سەرەتاییەکە، پردێکی تەلەفۆنی بەپەلە ئامادە بکە کە هەموو کەسێک کە کار لەسەر ئەم چیرۆکە دەکات دەتوانێت پەیوەندی بکات بۆ گوێگرتن لە دوایین پێشهاتەکان. ئەمە ڕێگە بە مێزی هەواڵی تۆ دەدات بۆ جەختکردنەوە لەسەر دووپاتکردنەوەی هێڵەکان و لینینگ لەگەڵ تیمەکان لەسەر زەوی لەجیاتی ئەوەی چەندین پەیوەندی لە ژوورەکانی کۆنترۆڵ یان بەڕێوەبەرەکان بکەن.

Other news outlets. We rarely use other news outlets as our source for a breaking news story. But on the rare occasion we don't have our own team on the ground and we can't rely on wire services or official sources, we may cite the reporting of an another outlet. Is this an official news outlet in the locality of the breaking news? Is this an affiliate of ours that we have relied on in the past? Do they have a good previous track record? Are they in a position to have access to information we might not have right now? If the answer to the above questions are yes, then we may report the information by clearly attributing to the original source of the information.

That means reaching out to official sources, such as police and emergency services or government spokespeople, to try to stand up facts and get reportable lines. But remember, there is a lot of confusion during the early hours of a breaking news story, especially a natural disaster or terrorist attack, so even official sources might be getting incorrect information.

We only use social media as a source when, and if, we can verify the information or content that is being shared.

Don't forget, there's often a fog of confusion and misinformation during the early hours of a breaking news story, especially if it relates to a natural disaster or an attack. Some of the official sources that we normally rely on to confirm these stories may themselves be in disarray. They might be dealing with injured people, or an influx of information, or being chased by the press looking for information. That means they are extremely busy and might not be as reliable when it comes to giving an accurate assessment of the situation. Meanwhile, different news outlets might be putting out contradictory statements and social media posts might be amplifying rumours.

You need to make sure that what you are reporting is as accurate as possible under the circumstances.

Breaking news coverage is a marathon not a sprint. You need to confirm the basic elements of a story as quickly and as reliably as you can. Then, you can incrementally build the story out by providing more context and by updating the audience with new reportable lines when they become available.

Social Newsgathering

Social media is both at its best and its worst during a breaking news situation. Anyone with a smartphone and an internet connection has the ability to perform some of the tasks of a professional journalist. They can tell the public what they are seeing, they can gather content and share it widely and they can give an account of what has happened.

تۆڕەکۆمەڵایەتیەکان هەمو لە باشترین و هەمو خراپترینیاندایە لە کاتی رەوشی هەواڵی تێکشکاویدا هەر کەسێک مۆبایلێکی زیرەک و پەیوەندی ئینتەرنێتی هەبێت توانای ئەوەی هەیە هەندێک لە ئەرکەکانی ڕۆژنامەنووسێکی پرۆفیشناڵ جێبەجێ بکات دەتوانن بە ڕای گشتی بڵێن کە چی دەبینن، دەتوانن ناوەڕۆک کۆ بکەنەوە و بە فراوانی هاوبەشی بکەن و دەتوانن حیسابێک لەسەر ئەو شتانە بکەن کە ڕوویداوە

But, the downside is there can also be a lot of misinformation on social media during a breaking news situation. That is why we have the social newsgathering team. It is a relatively new team within the bigger newsgathering operation focused on verifying information that is being shared on social media. They are CNN's experts in figuring out whether content shared online is true using forensic examination to verify information.  In many ways, they are our first eyes and ears on the ground figuring out what happened, who it happened to, when it happened and where it happened.

How do you verify video or images posted on social media?
چۆن ڤیدیۆ یان ئەو وێنانە پشتڕاست دەکەیتەوە کە لە تۆڕە کۆمەڵایەتییەکاندا بڵاو کراوەتەوە؟

The key is context clues. Look at the data you can gather from the content that is being shared and see if they match with the story they are allegedly showing or with facts that you may already have about an incident. Then take a look at the video or image and see if anything stands out that might not be true. If, for example, a shooting happened at night why is there daylight in the video allegedly showing the moment it happened? If a stampede, for example, took place at a football stadium in France during the summer why is there snow on the ground in an alleged photo of the incident?

So, look for the context clues you can find in the videos or images being shared and build up your confidence in their authenticity.

Another key role of the social newsgathering team is battling the misinformation and disinformation that is a feature of our current media ecosystem. Hours after a breaking news event, there are often doctored videos or unrelated images that are shared and claimed to be of the event. You have to be extra vigilant and remember to use all the tools at your disposal to verify what is being shared.

Deploying more resources: It was clear from early in the story that Ben wasn't going to single-handedly meet the coverage demands of the story for our different platforms and networks. So plans were made to deploy reporting teams from Istanbul and Abu Dhabi to boost the CNN presence on the ground in Beirut.

بڵاوکردنەوەی سەرچاوەی زیاتر: لە سەرەتای چیرۆکەکەوە ئەوە ڕوون بوو کە بێن بە تەنیا بە یەک دەست داواکاریەکانی ڕووماڵکردنی چیرۆکەکە بۆ پلاتفۆرم و تۆڕە جیاوازەکانمان جێبەجێ ناکات. بۆیە پلان بۆ بڵاو کردنەوەی تیمی ڕاپۆرت لە ئیستەنبول و ئەبوزەبی بۆ بەهێزکردنی ئامادەبوونی سی ئێن ئێن لەسەر زەوی لە بەیروت.

Social Newsgathering: Our social discovery team was able to recognize the scope of the blast and to search for people who were posting about within the vicinity. Paul was able to use context clues from the videos being uploaded to verify their authenticity and to track down an eyewitness on a boat who shared his footage with CNN adding an extra layer to our coverage.

هەواڵی کۆمەڵایەتی: تیمی دۆزینەوەی کۆمەڵایەتی ئێمە توانییان مەودای تەقینەوەکە بناسنەوە و بەدوای ئەو کەسانەدا بگەڕێن کە لە دەوروبەریان بڵاویان دەکردەوە پاوڵ توانی بەڵگەکانی دەق بەکاربهێنێت لەو ڤیدیۆیانەی کە بارکراون بۆ سەلماندنی ڕەسەنایەتی و بەدواداچوونی شایەتحاڵێک لەسەر بەلەمێک کە گرتە ڤیدیۆکەی لەگەڵ سی ئێن ئێن بڵاو کردەوە کە چینێکی زیادە بۆ داپۆشینەکەمان زیاد دەکات.

Prioritizing on the ground: As you can see from the clips in the gallery below, our Beirut bureau was also severely damaged by the explosion. That meant that when our producer Ghazi got to the bureau he had to prioritize and multi-task. Before getting to the bureau, he dispatched a freelance cameraman to shoot some footage that would be used in the coverage. Once at the bureau, he made sure that there were security plans in place to protect valuables and conducted a health and safety assessment to make sure the team could operate in the office. Meanwhile, he helped Ben chase editorial lines.

ئەولەویەتی لەسەر زەوی: وەک دەبینیت لە کلیپەکانی ناو گەلەری خوارەوە، فەرمانگەی بەیروتمان بەهۆی تەقینەوەکەوە بە سەختی زیانی پێگەیشتووە ئەوە مانای ئەوە بوو کە کاتێک بەرهەمهێنەکەمان غازی گەیشتە ئەولایەت و ئەرکی فرە پێش ئەوەی بگەرێتە نوسینگەکە، ئەو کامێرامانێکی فریلانسی نارد بۆ ئەوەی چەند گرتەیەک بتەقێنێت کە لە داپۆشینەکەدا بەکار دەهێنرێت. جارێک لە فەرمانگەکە، ئەو دڵنیای کردەوە کە پلانی ئەمنی هەیە بۆ پاراستنی بەهادارەکان و هەڵسەنگاندنێکی تەندروستی و سەلامەتی ئەنجام دا بۆ دڵنیابوون لەوەی کە تیمەکە دەتوانێت لە ئۆفیسەکە کار بکات لە هەمان کاتدا، ئەو یارمەتی بێن چەیسی سەرنووسەرەکانی دا.

Confirming & Reporting: With Ben and his team on the ground in Beirut, CNN was in a position to immediately confirm the story from and to provide breaking news coverage for its audience. Ben was able to go live, first on the phone then on camera, and provide reporting what was happening to him. He was doing this while getting updates from Ghazi, his producer, and contacts throughout Beirut. Our planning team was also able to set up interviews with other eyewitnesses on the ground to provide additional perspectives.

The COVID-19 global pandemic has added multiple considerations and layers to our decision-making matrix during breaking news situations. Our most important priority is the safety of our team.  When we are deploying teams we want to ensure their health is being protected at all times. That means sourcing PPE equipment for them, thinking about how to isolate teams and have contingency plans if teams need to be separated. It has also brought about additional travel restrictions and quarantine requirements which restrict the movements of our teams and limit our access to a story.

One of the key elements during a breaking news situation is how different CNN teams communicate with one another. Our teams in the field need to be able to relay information about what is happening on the ground to our newsgathering hubs in Atlanta, New York, London, Abu Dhabi or Hong Kong. Key Takeaways
کلیلی هەڵاتن

Breaking news is something unexpected that is important enough for you to modify your regular programming to tell the audience about it. It is happening right now and requires the entire newsroom to shift into breaking news coverage mode.

هەواڵ شکاندن شتێکی چاوەڕوان نەکراوە کە زۆر گرنگە بۆ تۆ بۆ چاککردنەوەی بەرنامەسازی ئاساییت بۆ ئەوەی دەربارەی ئەوە بە بینەران بڵێیت. لە ئێستادا ڕوودەدات و پێویستی بە هەموو ژووری هەواڵەکانە بۆ ئەوەی بگۆڕن بۆ دۆخی ڕووماڵکردنی هەواڵەکان.

Reporting. In the immediate aftermath of a breaking news event, give your audience a sense of what is happening right now and provide them with the broader picture. Don't get bogged down in the details of the story or nuances that you can weave into the narrative at a later stage.

ڕاپۆرت کردن لە دوای ڕووداوی هەواڵی خێرا، هەستێک بە بینەرەکانت بدە کە ئێستا چی ڕوودەدات و وێنەی فراوانتریان بۆ دابین بکە. لە وردەکارییەکانی چیرۆکەکە یان ئەو نوسانە دا مەکە کە دەتوانیت لە قۆناغی دواتردا بۆ چیرۆکەکە بکۆڵیتەوە.

Verification. Your biggest priority during breaking news coverage is verifying the information that is pouring in. At the very least, you need to double source all the lines that you want to report on a story. Don't get lost in the fog of rumours and misinformation and don't sacrifice accuracy for speed.

سەلماندن گەورەترین ئەولەویەتی تۆ لە کاتی ڕووماڵکردنی هەواڵەکان، سەلماندنی ئەو زانیاریانەیە کە دەڕژێنە ناوەوە. بەلایەنی کەمەوە، پێویستە هەموو ئەو هێڵانەی کە دەتەوێت ڕاپۆرت لەسەر چیرۆکێک بدەن، دوو هێندە سەرچاوە بکەیت. لە تەمی پڕوپاگەندە و زانیاری هەڵەدا ون مەبە و ڕێک و پێکی بۆ خێرایی مەکە

Communication. You need to ensure you are communicating what you know about a breaking news event both internally and to your audience. By alerting the rest of the network that you are aware of a breaking news situation you not only prepare them for it, you give yourself the opportunity to confirm reportable lines.

پەیوەندی کردن تۆ پێویستە دڵنیابیتەوە لەوەی کە تۆ دەیزانی دەربارەی ڕووداوی هەواڵی بەپەلە لە ناوخۆ و هەم بۆ جەماوەرەکەت. بە ئاگادارکردنەوەی ئەوانی تری تۆڕەکە کە ئاگادارن لە دۆخی هەوالێکی تێکشکاوی تۆ نەک هەر بۆی ئامادە دەکەیت، دەرفەت بە خۆت دەدەیت بۆ پشتڕاستکردنەوەی هێڵە ڕاپۆرت پێکراوەکان.
Nobody remembers if you broke a story two minutes before somebody else. But, a lot of people will remember if you got it first and you got it wrong.
